intro: [WRONG START] Astrantia dondiiifolia, commonly known as the lacecap asters, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern Europe. It features showy, flat-topped flower clusters that bloom in shades of pink, purple, and white, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are typically bluish-green in color. It thrives in partial to full shade and moist, well-drained soil, making it suitable for woodland gardens. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological landscapes.
